sect1.title: Menubar
sect1.para: At the top of the GnomeSword main window is the menubar. Almost all of the functions are available by activating the appropriate menu item. The functions have been grouped according to their type. For example, the file operations have been grouped into the File menu.

sect1.title: Toolbars
sect1.para: The function of the Toolbar is to allow quick and easy control over the Bible Pane. Activation of the Toolbar option is done by simply moving the mouse cursor over the desired toolbar button and selecting it. A tooltip will appear if the mouse cursor is held stationary over a toolbar button, describing the function of the button.
The Toolbar consists of the following functions:

sect2.title: History Forward/Backward Selector
sect2.para: Allows quick and easy switching between current and previous passage selections.

sect2.title: Parallel View Toggle
sect2.para: Allows quick switching between single translation and multiple translation displays.

sect2.title: Bible Book Selector
sect2.para: Allows quick selection of the Biblical book to be displayed in the Bible Text Pane and Commentary Pane. Changes take immediate effect.

sect2.title: Bible Chapter Selector
sect2.para: Allows quick selection of Biblical chapter of current book to be displayed in the Bible Text Pane and Commentary Pane. Changes take immediate effect.

sect2.title: Bible Verse Selector
sect2.para: Allows quick selection of Biblical verse of current chapter to be displayed in the Bible Text Pane and Commentary Pane. Changes take immediate effect.

sect2.title: Bible Passage Summary
sect2.para: Allows manual editing of passages which are displayed in the Bible Text Pane and Commentary Pane. Changes only take effect once button on the right is clicked.

warning.para: Ensure that edited book,chapter and verse naming is correct, otherwise the wrong or no information will be displayed.

sect1.title: The Sidebar
sect1.para: On the left hand side of GnomeSword2 there is the shortcut bar. Here the user can quickly and easily switch between the different Bible texts, commentaries, dictionaries and general books. You can also select and edit your bookmarks, view search results, view verse lists and view your daily devotional book by simply clicking on the module icon and select your selection.

sect1.title: The Bible Text Pane
sect1.para: Positioned to the right of the Shortcut bar is the Bible text pane. All your different translations will be displayed for full viewing. When starting GnomeSword2 either your default Bible translation or the translation last used will be displayed.

sect2.title: Opening A Specific Bible Translation
sect2.para: In order to change the current Bible translation to another of your choice simply:

listitem.para: right-click in the Bible Text Pane .In the popup menu choose FileOpen Module and select your specific translation that you want to view.
under the Modules option in the Sidebar,choose Biblical Textslanguage choice and select your specific translation.

sect2.title: Opening A Seperate Bible Translation
sect2.para: In order to view a Bible translation separate from the GnomeSword2 interface,simply:

listitem.para: right-click in the Bible Text pane. In the popup menu choose FileOpen current in a dialog Module .
Under the Modules option in the Sidebar,choose Biblical Textslanguage choice . Then right-click on your specific translation and choose the Open in dialog option.

sect2.title: Finding Out About The Current Translation
sect2.para: To find out about the Bible translation currently being displayed simply:

listitem.para: right-click in the Bible Text pane.In the popup menu choose About module name.

sect2.title: Module Options
sect2.para: Most Bible translations have additional options which the user can enable or disable. These include:

note.para: Translations in other languages such as Greek or Hebrew have specific options which deal only with the specific language.

sect2.para: In order to access these options simply:

listitem.para: right-click in the Bible Text pane. In the popup menu choose Module Options and select the specific option.

sect2.title: Specific Word Meanings
sect2.para: In order to check the meaning of a specific word, simply click on the desired word you wish to lookup. The word should then highlight itself and the explanation should be displayed, if available, in the Dictionary Pane.

sect2.title: Finding A Specific Word
sect2.para: To find a specific word within a passage, simply:

listitem.para: right-click in the Bible Text Pane.In the popup menu, choose Edit-> Find. A separate dialog will appear,which will allow single or multi word searches. Simply fill out dialog and click the Find button.

sect1.title: The Commentary Pane
sect1.para: The Commentary pane is where the commentary modules are displayed. This provides easy reading, reference and access to different commentaries currently installed. The passage viewed by the Commentary pane is directly controlled by the current passage viewed in the Bible Text pane, so in order to change to a different passage commentary, simply select the desired passage on the Toolbar.

note.para: By changing to passage settings on the Toolbar, the contents in the Bible Text pane and the Commentary Pane will be changed.

sect2.title: Finding Out About The Commentary Module
sect2.para: To find out about the commentary currently being displayed simply:

listitem.para: right-click in the Commentary Pane. In the popup menu choose About module name.

sect2.title: Commentary Headings.
sect2.para: Most commentaries have additional headings which enable introductory information about the book and chapter currently being displayed in the Bible Text pane. In order to view them, simply:

listitem.para: right-click in the Commentary Pane. In the popup menu choose File->Navigate ->Chapter Heading

sect2.para: Repeat the steps above and choose Book Heading, instead of Chapter Heading , if you want view the Book Headings.
